summary:
Blessed with a multi-lingual and loving family whilst growing up in The Netherlands, I've always had a great love for languages, cross-cultural interaction and communication, understanding others, and seeing opportunities to introduce the right people to each other and trade knowledge, goods, and services.

My professional career was shaped by working my dream job at the Dutch Embassy in Prague and exploring the world of hospitality from the 'blue' side @ Booking.com.

As a founding father of Mews, which quickly grew to travel- and fintech's new-age industry leader, I had the challenging pleasure of contracting, training, supporting and account managing our clients and partners in the early days. Signing 100+ clients, implementing over 100 more, and conducting countless consultation projects to clients and our teams along the way.

2019 marked my return to The Netherlands to expand Mews in the Benelux and set the foundation for our family life. Inspiring Mewsers, with an emphasis on the Benelux commercial team, brought great joy and resulted in becoming salesperson of the year.
In 2020, it was my great pleasure to coach the brilliant Winner Hotel Software team - Mews' first-ever acquisition of another company.

Over the years, I gained an incredible network of (not only) hospitality professionals and enthusiasts. 
It has become my mission to inspire colleagues, clients, non-clients, business partners, and my family with new ideas and business opportunities.

In the spring of 2020, I embarked on multiple new journeys when founding Happy Inspirer.
Asides from a loving family life, these journeys include adding my value to industry-leading pricing app RoomPriceGenie, consulting independent hoteliers, and expanding our family business.

"To continuously learn, give & add value to all aspects of life are the key to a happy life."
And it is my great pleasure to pave the way to happiness together with you!

profile_positions.description:
In the fall of 2020, I joined the RoomPriceGenie team because I experienced its incredible value to ‘emotional’ hoteliers first-hand when consulting my hotel-owning friends. And I've made it my personal mission to enable the power of Pricing with all hoteliers that are keen to generate more income and enhance their daily life.

Automated Pricing is an element everyone should get started with. It’s not a luxury anymore; it is absolutely essential. And channeling its essence through Partners is the fastest way to spread the word.

The status quo of Partnerships in hospitality tech is a high focus on ‘connecting with Partners’ and a rather low focus on generating actual business & income.
My approach to business is very commercial and I challenge this status quo with a "Less bureaucracy, more business" approach.

Partnerships play a key role in scaling businesses together and must be approached with the goal to truly help our Partners and jointly acquire new revenue.

I specialize in enabling RoomPriceGenie's Partners to educate their audience and acquire new business together by truly joining forces.
profile_positions.title: Head of Partnerships @ RoomPriceGenie

profile_positions.description: Happy Inspirer assists hospitality tech companies in their growth through efficient Sales and Partnerships & inspires accommodation owners to grow their brand and business by creating revenue-driven guest journeys and optimizing internal processes.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
The thing I love most is (re)building a group's or individual accommodation's tech stack; their ecosystem of softwares.
With a focus on driving revenue. 

Many hoteliers want to use 'the hot brands of the moment', but don't know why nor how to put the pieces of the puzzle together into something that makes sense.

In no time, I'll revise their current ecosystem, (often non-existent) guest journeys and advise where to save on internal admin.

I'm rather looking at adding value to a client immediately than going for an ongoing relationship with heavy monthly fees.

I've enjoyed doing this for years and now in pandemic times, the need has never been higher.

Size, type, and segmentation of the accommodation don't matter; the mindset of the owner does. 
I'm not going to learn someone tricks they're not open for, but happily put all my energy into someone wanting to change their current ways of operating the business.
profile_positions.title: Consultancy for Accommodation owners

profile_positions.description:
October 2019 brought a new wave of energy into Mews, as we merged with our first-ever acquired platform: Winner Hotel Software.

With a small core Mews project team & the Winners, we're migrating all Winner clients onto Mews.
An at times challenging and incredibly rewarding journey.
In our roles, instead of pitching the platform to clients, we chat about the endless possibilities of making guests & hotel teams happier and generate business in an automated and efficient way.

And the feedback, as well as the results, were incredible. Not only did the majority of Winner users want to migrate as soon as possible during the COVID madness, but the increased efficiency of internal operations, automation in guest communication, and increase in additional revenue streams was flabbergasting!

Aside from this, I signed Mews' largest sales deal to date: The Student Hotel group.
This was the longest & intense, and certainly the most rewarding, project in my sales days. 
A huge 'Thank you' to all involved!

Key projects I worked on at this time were, among others:
- Return on Investment calculator (Yes, Mews is not the cheapest platform on the market. And once you calculate how much value it adds, you're amazed by the returns you'll make).
- Student accommodation & Hybrid accommodation providers.

2) Design, implement & execute complex guest journeys
3) Design and implement team workflows and procedures

No matter the team size, number of rooms, or complexity of services; these 3 elements form the base of a succesful business.

profile_positions.description:
Partner management is all about building and maintaining relationships with our resellers around the globe and train them in what they do best: represent Mews Systems in their home region.
Key to this is ensuring they have all the information and tools in order to provide strong operational support to our clients.

This support consists of local on-site, as well as online trainings, shadowing our partners, building out a Reseller Portal, streamlining the reseller onboarding process and providing deep account management to ensure a perfect relationship with our partners.
